dlgPart.npc_text: 君はダラタンの敷地前に立っている。先の尖った杭でできた柵が敷地の周囲を縁取り、武装した見張りがその守りを強化していた。ここから見える入り口は二つある。一つは本館に通じるもので、もう一つは衛兵の宿舎に通じるものだ。残念ながら、どちらの入り口もクロスボウを持った者たちが配置された見張り塔の影に隠れている。

dlgAnsw.text: 貴族の格好をして入り込む。
dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: aod.npc_dellar_met == false && aod.quest_MQ_seeAntidas && aod.quest_mg2_goSeeAntidas == false && dlgGetItemsCount(509) >= 1 && aod.gender == 1

dlgAnsw.text: 貴族の格好をして入り込む。
dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: aod.npc_dellar_met == false && aod.quest_MQ_seeAntidas && aod.quest_mg2_goSeeAntidas == false && dlgGetItemsCount(510) >= 1 && aod.gender == 0

dlgAnsw.text: 入れてもらうように頼む。
Ask the guard to take you to Flavius.

dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: aod.quest_MQ_seeAntidas && aod.npc_antidas_met == false && aod.npc_antidas_metInCassiusBetray == false && aod.TPTA_failed == false

dlgPart.npc_text:
君は辺りを見回し、別の道を探す。柵は敷地の右翼を完全に保護している─この杭を乗り越えるのは至難の業だろう。左側は小さな金属の門がある古い石垣に守られている─過去の遺物だ。荒い石とぼろぼろのしっくいの石垣は登るのは簡単だろうが、まずは衛兵を片付けなければならない。
もちろん、適切な防具を身につけていれば、衛兵のふりができるだろう。ここではロリカ・セグメンタタの装備が使われているようだ。

dlgAnsw.text: 正面の入り口に近づく。
石垣の側にいる衛兵に近づく。
[impersonate]衛兵のふりをして衛兵の入り口を通る。
衛兵の注意を引かないように敷地の右側の柵を登る。

dlgPart.npc_text: 君はダラタンの敷地の前に立ち、どうするか考えている。

dlgAnsw.text: 正面の入り口に近づく。
石垣の側にいる衛兵に近づく。
[impersonate]衛兵のふりをして衛兵の入り口を通る。
衛兵の注意を引かないように敷地の右側の柵を登る。

dlgPart.npc_text: END - start Dellar dialogue
END - start Dellar dialogue as noble
"This area is off-limits. You have until the count of five to leave. One... two..." Above you, the crossbowmen's armor creaks as they straighten at their posts, alert.

dlgAnsw.text: "I'm looking for Flavius. Tell him it's about the debt."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Follow me."
END - start Flavius dialogue
[failure]"This area is off-limits. You have until the count of five to leave. One... two..." Above you, the crossbowmen's armor creaks as they straighten at their posts, alert.

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion][streetwise]"I'm looking for a job. Are you saying you don't need more men?"

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"Not the likes of you. Get lost."
[success]"We do need more men, but –"

dlgAnsw.text: "Then I'd like to apply. Whom should I talk to?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Flavius is in charge, but I can't let you in."

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion]"Look, I don't want to get you in trouble, but what do you think Flavius would say when he finds out that you've been turning new recruits away?"

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"You're getting on my nerves now. For the last time, you have until the count of five to leave. One... two..."
[success]"Alright. You want to see Flavius? I'll take you to Flavius. Let's go."

[success]You push the fear from your mind and concentrate on getting into character as you start walking. Your gait is transformed, becoming slow, lazy, and confident, the swagger of a military man. You meet the guard's eyes and nod in greeting, your expression bored. A grunt is your only answer; losing interest, the guard turns away, and you walk inside the compound.

[failure]You push the fear from your mind and concentrate on getting into character as you start walking. The guard watches you as you approach, then raises his arm in warning. "Who the fuck are you?"

dlgAnsw.text: [impersonate]"I'm looking for a job. My father was a guardsman all his life; this is his old armor. I want to serve Daratan like my old man did. Please..."
[streetwise][impersonate]"They told me to report in today. I guess I'm early. There should be a lot more people."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Nice try. This area is off-limits. You have until the count of five to leave. One... two..." Above you, the crossbowmen's armor creaks as they straighten at their posts, alert.

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion]"I'm looking for a job. Are you saying you don't need more men?"

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"If you want a job, talk to Dellar. He might have something for you." The guard chuckles.
[success]"Did your old man have any tattoos?"

dlgAnsw.text: [lore]"Two gladii forming the number 'II' over a burning fort on his left shoulder."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Then go tell your sad stories someplace else." The guard puts his hand on the pommel of his sword.
"Aragont. The second cohort." The guard nods and his expression changes. "Alright. Go see Flavius. He'll take care of you."
[failure]"I don't know anything about it. Come back later if you want."
[success]The guard looks bewildered and confused. "A lot more people?"
"Trouble? No. I don't think so. At least nobody told me."

dlgAnsw.text: "I hear you. It's the same bullshit everywhere. Nobody tells you anything. So, whom should I report to?"

dlgPart.npc_text: The guard shrugs. "Talk to Flavius, I guess. He's in the guardhouse."

dlgAnsw.text: "Thanks. I owe you a pint." Go inside the guardhouse.

dlgPart.npc_text:
You find yourself in what was once a warehouse, but now serves as a mess hall - rough but broom-swept and neat. An acrid mixture taints the air with the aromas of spilled ale, cabbage and smoke.
The mess hall is empty at the moment. You see several tables, a small bar, and a makeshift ladder disappearing into an open hatch in the ceiling. A door leads into the back of the building – personal quarters? Another door leads west, in the direction of the main building.

dlgAnsw.text: Explore the back of the guardhouse.
[sneak]Go outside, toward the right side of the compound.
Go outside, toward the right side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text: You return to the mess hall. You see several tables, a small bar, and a makeshift ladder disappearing into an open hatch in the ceiling. A door leads into the back of the building, another door leads west, in the direction of the main building.

dlgAnsw.text: Explore the back of the guardhouse.
[sneak]Go outside, toward the right side of the compound.
Go outside, toward the right side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text: This is a small barrack. There are several sleeping men among the rows of beds and a few chests.

dlgAnsw.text: Use this opportunity to redistribute some wealth to the needy - yourself.

dlgPart.npc_text: You spot your prize instantly. Judging by the craftsmanship, the chest probably cost its owner at least twenty imperials. A rich strongbox means a rich reward, provided you can get past the lock.

dlgAnsw.text: [lockpick][sneak]Pick the lock. As quietly as you can.

dlgPart.npc_text: [lockpick failure]You fail to open the lock.

[lockpick success][sneak failure]It takes you some time, but finally the lock surrenders to your skill. You lift the lid and look inside. Just as you're reaching for the carefully wrapped belongings, something slams into your back sending you crashing into a wall.
"Steal from me, will you?" You lift your face from the floor to see a furious guardsman stalking toward you, arms bulging as he lifts a massive hammer overhead.

[success]You fling yourself aside, feeling the passage of the air as the hammer misses you by inches. It slams into the floor beside you, wood splintering as the guard stumbles, over-extended and temporarily off-balance. Seizing the opportunity, you hurl yourself to your feet and hurriedly evaluate the situation. Not good. The other guards have woken up and are grabbing their weapons. One of them locks the door with a click and turns back to you, his eyes alight with bloodlust. You're going to have to fight your way out.
FIGHT - barracks

You look at the dead bodies sprawled around you and the blood slowly spreading on the floor. An unfortunate turn of events, but better them than you.
You stop and listen, but hear no sounds of alarm. Either the door is soundproof or the guardhouse is often used for combat training. You go back to the chest. Inside you find a roll of coins, carefully wrapped in some cloth, and a centurion armor and helmet. The armor has seen better days, but it's been well maintained and cleaned.

dlgAnsw.text: Put them on and go to the main building.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You attempt to roll aside but you're not fast enough. The hammer slams into your leg, agony ripping through you as your knee shatters. The hammer rises and falls two more times before another guard decides to show you mercy and stabs you with his spear, ending your torment.

[success]It's a basic three-tumbler lock. You spend more time oiling the lock and the hinges to avoid making any noise than pushing the tumblers out of the way.
Inside you find a roll of coins, carefully wrapped in some cloth, and a centurion armor and helmet. The armor has seen better days, but it's been well maintained and cleaned.

dlgAnsw.text: Put them on and go to the main building.

dlgPart.npc_text: It's a small storage area. Much of the roof has caved in here. A makeshift bridge leads to one of the wall towers. Several men are working slowly, removing wine amphorae from a crate. They don't seem to be paying any attention to you.

"'Cause you're dying to help us, aren't you, <boy/girl>? What is it you want? Spit it out." One of the servants – an old, but hard looking man, not broken by the years of servitude – stops working, drinks some wine from a cup, and gives you a long stare.

dlgAnsw.text: "I'd like to buy an amphora. And your robes. They seem oddly comfortable."
[impersonate]"‘cause I was sent here to make sure the wine gets to the palace today, not next week, you old oaf."
"Alright. Let's do it the hard way. Give me your clothes and one of the amphorae. Now!"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Oddly comfortable." The old man grins at you. "They are yours for only 250 imperials. I'll throw in the amphorae for free."

dlgAnsw.text: "Are you out of you mind? 250 imperials for these rags?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Do you take me to be stupid, <boy/girl>? 250 imperials for getting into the palace uninvited. Or for my boys not breaking your legs." As if on cue, the "boys" stop working and produce spiked clubs.

dlgAnsw.text: [trading]"I'll give you 200. It's less than 250, but more than you'll get after you pay the guards to keep quiet about breaking people legs and extorting money. It's a good deal. Don't be greedy and take it."
"I don't have that kind of money."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"I don't think so. I hate people who waste my time. Break <his/her> legs and throw <him/her> off the roof, boys."

[success]"Pleasure doing business." The old man gives you an extra set of servant robes and an amphora. "If they ask, tell them that Darabus sent you. Speak with an accent; this way nobody will ask you too many questions."

dlgAnsw.text: Put them on, pick up the amphora, and go to the passage.

dlgPart.npc_text: [charisma success]"Listen, you seem like a nice person. I don't want to break your legs, but you have to be reasonable. 220. Just for you. What do you say?"
"Too bad. I hate people who waste my time. Break <his/her> legs and throw <him/her> off the roof, boys."
"Too bad. I hate people who waste my time. Break <his/her> legs and throw <him/her> off the roof, boys."

"Pleasure doing business." The old man gives you an extra set of servant robes and an amphora. "If they ask, tell them that Darabus sent you. Speak with an accent; this way nobody will ask you too many questions."

dlgAnsw.text: Put them on, pick up the amphora, and go to the passage.

dlgPart.npc_text: "Figured as much. 250 imperials and the robes are yours. I'll throw in the amphorae for free."

dlgAnsw.text: "Are you out of you mind? 250 imperials for these rags?"

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"You like telling tall stories, do you, <boy/girl>? Well, let me tell you a story about a <boy/girl> who thought <he/she> was smarter than everyone else. It's my favourite story because the hero dies in the end."

dlgAnsw.text: "Alright, alright. I need to see Lord Antidas..."

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]"Next week?" The old man protests feebly. "The wine will be there shortly."

dlgAnsw.text: "It should have been there already! Give me an amphora. Move it already!"

dlgPart.npc_text: The old man sighs, picks up a large and dusty amphora and hands it to you.

dlgAnsw.text: "Clothes! I said give me some work clothes first. Are you deaf? By gods, whoever hired you imbeciles should be executed."

dlgPart.npc_text: The old man hands you the work robes without saying a word.

dlgAnsw.text: Put them on, pick up the amphora, and go to the passage.

dlgPart.npc_text: "The hard way, is it?" The old man spits on his hands and picks up a large hammer. The other men stop working, pull out spiked clubs, and start slowly advancing toward you.
FIGHT - slaves

You look at the dead bodies sprawled around you and the blood slowly spreading on the floor. An unfortunate turn of events, but better them than you.
You stop and listen, but hear no sounds of alarm. You take the worker robes and an amphora, heading to the passage.

dlgAnsw.text: Put them on and go to the passage.

dlgPart.npc_text: You open the door and step inside a crudely constructed, narrow passageway connecting both buildings. The passageway is guarded and the guard is clearly surprised to receive visitors. Before he starts reaching for his sword, you:

dlgAnsw.text: [impersonate]Bark "Is that how you salute an officer, swine? Stop eyeballing me! You're not worthy to look your superiors in the eyes. Stand straight, eyes forward!"
Give him a tired smile of a <man/woman> accustomed to servitude and say "Wine for master."
Get back into the guard house.
dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: aod.TPTA_captain_armor == false && aod.TPTA_slave_disguise == false && aod.TPTA_slave_darabus == false

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]The guard is fast and well trained. A heavy shield is smashed into your face, blurring your vision. You see a flash of metal and suddenly pain erupts in your chest, drowning your scream and attempts to draw air. You die before your body hits the ground.

[success]The guard is fast and well trained. His sword clears the scabbard and catches you as you lunge. Lucky for you, your aim was truer - your dagger finds the guard's neck and his eyes slowly roll up as he loses all interest in you.
You pull his sword out of the wound and bandage it as best as you can. The way is clear.

[success]The guard is fast and well trained, but he is no match for you. By the time he raises his shield, your dagger is buried in his neck and his eyes roll up as he loses all interest in you. The way is clear.

[failure]Your performance is good, but the guard isn't fooled. He smiles unpleasantly and hits his shield with the flat of his sword. The sound rings through the passage, instantly alerting every guard in the vicinity.
Within heartbeats the passage is stormed and you're pinned to the ground and shackled. The rest is a trip downhill. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated.

[success]Your performance is flawless and the air of superiority forces the guard to discard any doubts he may have had and snap to the position ordered. You stare at him for another moment, shake your head, and walk past him.
"Who sent you to fetch wine?"

dlgAnsw.text: [impersonate]"Darabus. Darabus say, "Master need vine," give me amphora to carry - I carry."

[impersonate]"I'm a lowly servant, lord captain. They tell me to bring food, I bring food. They tell me to bring wine, I bring wine. I don't ask why – it's not my place. Would lord captain like some wine?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
[failure]Your performance is good, but the guard isn't fooled. He smiles unpleasantly and hits his shield with the flat of his sword. The sound rings through the passage, instantly alerting every guard in the vicinity.
Within heartbeats the passage is stormed and you're pinned to the ground and shackled. The rest is a trip downhill. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated.
[success]The guard nods and reluctantly steps aside, opening the door for you.
[success]"I have orders not to let anyone in during the audience. You'll have to wait."

dlgAnsw.text: "I can wait, my lord captain. Gods know I could use a break. The lord who sent me... I don't think he wants to wait. By the looks of him, I don't think he has ever had to wait for anything. Not the type, my lord captain, if you know what I mean."

dlgPart.npc_text: The guard nods and reluctantly steps aside, opening the door for you.
"Get lost," says the guard lazily, clearly expecting you to obey his order.

dlgAnsw.text: [critical strike]Kill him without attracting anyone's attention.
[streetwise]"The Commander wants to see you. He said that if you're drunk again, you'll be scrubbing floors for a week."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failed]Your attack is clumsy, ringing off his armor instead of opening his throat. The guard stumbles back, yelling for aid.

A few heartbeats later, a crossbow bolt hits you in the chest, the shock paralyzing you even as you're flung into the dirt. Your life starts flashing before your eyes, going faster and faster, until you drift away into the darkness.

[failure]Thinking quickly, you grab the guard's arm and try to pull him toward you. Once again, the attempt lacks the necessary finesse. The guard recovers his balance and brings his sword down, severing your arm. A heartbeat later, a crossbow bolt hits you in the chest, the shock paralyzing you even as you're flung into the dirt. Your life starts flashing before your eyes, going faster and faster, until you drift away into the darkness.

[success]Thinking quickly, you grab the guard's arm and pull him toward you. Surprise fills his face at your unexpected tactic, followed by pain as the crossbow bolt intended for you plunges into his back. Pushing the dying man aside you turn and rush to the safety of a nearby alleyway.

[failure]You turn around and run as fast as you can. For a second you think that you've made it and then a well aimed bolt hits you between the shoulder blades, the impact throwing you to the ground. Your life starts flashing before your eyes, going faster and faster, until you drift away into the darkness.
[success]You turn around and run, changing your direction randomly to throw off the aim of the crossbowmen. Several bolts whizz by you, failing to find the target, as you dart into a nearby alley.

[success]Your attack catches the guard by surprise and he dies before he has a chance to pull out his sword.
You quickly drag the corpse next to the wall, out of sight of the tower guard. You go through the guard's pockets, taking his key and a few coins. You inspect the helmet and the sword and then pack everything neatly into your backpack - an old bag with faded lettering you bought from a man who claimed to be an arcanist a long time ago.

dlgAnsw.text: Unlock the gate and go inside.

dlgPart.npc_text: After your failed to attempt to infiltrate the compound, the guards are on high alert, which makes any subsequent attempts to gain unauthorized entry impossible.
[failed]"Funny." The guard doesn't move.

dlgAnsw.text: [critical strike]Kill him without attracting anyone's attention.

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]"Why did he send *you*?"

dlgAnsw.text: "You can ask him that when you see him. Hurry up, he looked angry."

dlgPart.npc_text: The guard swears and storms off.
[failure]You fiddle with the lock, but fail to get all the pins up.

[success]It's an old, worn out lock that was probably a lot more challenging when it was new. One by one the pins yield to the pressure, clicking softly as they fall in position. You rotate the plug and open the door.
[failure]You start climbing, but make too much noise and get a warning shot for your efforts. Thanking the guard for his kindness you retreat into a nearby alley.
[success]You climb the wall without making a sound, none of the crossbowmen showing any sign of having noticed your ascent.
END - leave the TA

You are inside the palisade, standing near the side of the main building. To your left, the building's wing and the town wall form a corner. Save for a few dead shrubs, it's empty. To your right is the main courtyard. You can see several guards, but their attention is focused on the gate at the moment.

dlgAnsw.text: Quietly make your way to the corner and try to climb to the roof.
Quietly make your way to the back of the palace and sneak to the right side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text: You reach a dead corner, formed by the main building's wing and the town wall. Save for a few dead shrubs, it is empty. It's hard to find a better spot to climb the building.

dlgAnsw.text: [throwing]Use the rope with the grappling hook.
Quietly make your way to the back of the palace and sneak to the right side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You throw the rope several times, hoping not to attract guards' attention, but the grappling hook fails to catch and hold.

dlgAnsw.text: Quietly make your way to the back of the palace and sneak to the right side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]You expertly throw the rope, sending the grappling hook onto the roof. It catches with a soft clang and holds.

dlgAnsw.text: Quietly make your way to the back of the palace and sneak to the right side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You begin to climb. The old wall provides many easy handholds, but loose stones and crumbling plaster make climbing impossible.

dlgAnsw.text: [throwing]Use the rope with the grappling hook.
Quietly make your way to the back of the palace and sneak to the right side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You begin to climb up the rope. Unfortunately, you take too long and the grappling hook comes loose under your weight.

dlgAnsw.text: Quietly make your way to the back of the palace and sneak to the right side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text: Waiting for the guards patrolling the walls to pass, you move from one shadow to another, until you reach a dead corner, formed by the main building's wing and the town wall. Save for a few dead shrubs, it is empty. It's hard to find a better spot to climb the building.

dlgAnsw.text: [throwing]Use the rope with the grappling hook.
Quietly make your way to the back of the palace and sneak to the right side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text:
[success]You begin to climb. The old wall provides many easy handholds, but loose stones and crumbling plaster make climbing very challenging. After what seems like hours, you reach the roof and, hanging on the tips of your fingers, peek carefully to evaluate the situation.
The palace was built in better times, when sunlight was more important than security. Five windows placed around a decorative tower provide light, fresh air, and potential access for the uninvited. Heavy locks and a guard walking a slow circuit around the tower aim to discourage unannounced visitors.
If you're fast, you'll be able to pick the lock on the nearest hatch and jump down, praying that you won't land on top of a guard. If you want to pick a better landing spot, you'll have to take the guard out first.

dlgAnsw.text: [critical strike][sneak]Wait for the guard to pass you, get behind him, and kill him.

dlgPart.npc_text:
[success]You begin to climb up the rope and reach the roof in no time. Hanging on the tips of your fingers, you peek carefully to evaluate the situation.
The palace was built in better times, when sunlight was more important than security. Five windows placed around a decorative tower provide light, fresh air, and potential access for the uninvited. Heavy locks and a guard walking a slow circuit around the tower aim to discourage unannounced visitors.
If you're fast, you'll be able to pick the lock on the nearest hatch and jump down, praying that you won't land on top of a guard. If you want to pick a better landing spot, you'll have to take the guard out first.

dlgAnsw.text: [critical strike][sneak]Wait for the guard to pass you, get behind him, and kill him.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You fiddle with the lock, but fail to open it in time and have to retreat.

dlgAnsw.text: [critical strike][sneak]Wait for the guard to pass you, get behind him, and kill him.
Go down and head towards the west of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]The lock looks heavy and impressive, but the actual mechanism is surprisingly simple. You open it faster than if you had the key. Hanging by your fingertips within the hatch, you carefully close the portal above you and drop down.

[failure]As the guard passes you, you silently climb up and move across the roof like a shadow. You're about to reach out and cut his throat, when the guard whirls around, drawing his gladius and opening your belly in the same movement. For a while, you attempt to keep your intestines from falling out, but it's not a game that you can win. Your death is quick but painful.

[success]As the guard passes you, you silently climb up and move across the roof like a shadow. You're about to reach out and cut his throat, when the guard whirls around, slashing you with his sword. You ram your dagger between his ribs and he falls to the ground.
You bandage the wound as best as you can.

[success]As the guard passes you, you silently climb up and move across the roof like a shadow. When you get within a striking distance, you lunge, clapping your hand over the guard's mouth as you ram your dagger between his ribs before gently lowering his body to the ground.

You strip the guard from everything valuable - including the key to the roof windows. Now that the coast is clear, you look for a good landing spot. Guards patrol the hallway and there are servants in several rooms. Your options seem to be limited to a currently empty display room where Antidas keeps his ancient curiosities and a bedroom.

dlgAnsw.text: Open the lock on the window over the display room.
Open the lock on the window over the bedroom.

dlgPart.npc_text:
[failure]You land heavily, a mere few steps behind a patrolling guard!
The guard's reaction is flawless. A heavy shield is smashed into your face, blurring your vision. You see a flash of metal and suddenly pain erupts in your chest, drowning your screams and attempts to draw air. You die before your body hits the ground.

[success]You drop down, landing without a sound behind a guard patrolling the hallway. In a dining chamber to your left several servants are clearing up a recent meal, their eyes fixed on their tasks. To your right is a nearly empty room with some display stands.
If you can slip by the servants, the dining room table would provide ideal cover. In the display room you would be fully exposed if someone were to walk in.

dlgAnsw.text: [sneak]Sneak into the dinner room and roll under the table.
Go into the display room and pray that nobody will come in.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You lunge at the guard but he reacts instantly. A heavy shield is smashed into your face, blurring your vision. You see a flash of metal and suddenly pain erupts in your chest, drowning your screams and attempts to draw air. You die before your body hits the ground.

[success]The guard is fast and well trained. His sword clears the scabbard and catches you as you lunge. Lucky for you, your aim was truer - your dagger finds the guard's neck and his eyes slowly roll up as he loses all interest in you.
You pull his sword out of the wound and bandage it as best as you can. The way is clear.

[success]The guard is fast and well trained, but he is no match for you. By the time he raises his shield, your dagger is buried in his neck and his eyes slowly roll up as he loses all interest in you. The way is clear.

[failure]You move as quickly and quietly as you can, but one of the servants sees and raises the alarm.
Before you can even grasp the situation unfolding before you, you're pinned to the ground and shackled. It's all downhill from there. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated.
[success]Seizing your opportunity, you duck into the dining room and roll under the table before the servants look up from their tasks.

dlgAnsw.text: Wait for the servants to finish.

dlgPart.npc_text: When the servants leave, you get out and explore the room. The only items of interests are several golden goblets and a well crafted steel dagger used for carving meat. You pocket them and wait for the guard to pass.

dlgAnsw.text: Wait for the hallway to clear and make your way downstairs.
Wait for the hallway to clear and check the display room.

dlgPart.npc_text: You drop down, landing quietly between the display stands. The room is wide open and you can't stay there for too long.

dlgAnsw.text: Wait for the hallway to clear and make your way downstairs.

dlgPart.npc_text: Seizing your opportunity, you duck into the display room and blend with the wall, waiting until the guard walks away.

dlgAnsw.text: Wait for the hallway to clear and make your way downstairs.

dlgPart.npc_text: Making sure that the hallway is clear, you cross it and enter the display room.
[traps failure]As you take a step, a stone shifts under your foot and you hear the grinding of metal behind you. You whirl around and see thick metal bars going down across both exits.

dlgAnsw.text: [dexterity]Roll under the bars before they lock you inside the room.
Too risky, you might not make it.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You move as fast as you can, but you're not fast enough. The bars come down just as you start rolling and pin your leg. For a heartbeat, which takes forever, it seems that the bars have stopped, reaching the unexpected obstacle, but the unbearable pressure tells you that the worst is yet to come. You start screaming when the bars crush your bones and the guard has no choice but to decapitate you with one decisive swing to make you stop.

[success]You start moving the second you see the bars. You dive rolling under the bars and into the hallway. Luckily, the guard is far away.
You use this opportunity to leave this floor and go downstairs.
You're trapped, and unless you find a way to raise the bars before the guard comes back, you're as good as dead.

[failure]You look for the mechanism but find nothing. You're still searching for it when your time runs out. The guards have a bit of fun with you, shooting at you through the bars and making bets. The goal is hit the knees and elbows, so it takes awhile. You bleed out before the game ends.

[success]You methodically examine every object in the room, starting with the pressure plate that triggered the trap. When you reach the cabinet, a tap on one of the panels returns a hollow sound.
The panel slides easily to the side, exposing a maze of well-oiled gears, pipes, chains, and levers. It would take some expertise to figure out what to do with it.

[failure]Unsure of where to begin, you pull a random lever, but nothing happens. You're still trying to figure it out when your time runs out. The guards have a bit of fun with you, shooting at you through the bars and making bets. The goal is hit the knees and elbows, so it takes a while. You bleed out before the game ends.

[success]You take your time, trying not to think of the guard. You trace down all the pipes and gears, until you have a good idea of how to raise the bars. Using the levers you get the gears into the right position, pull another lever and the bars blocking the exits start slowly moving up. You silently make it out of the room and go downstairs.

[success]You take your time, trying not to think of the guard. You trace down all the pipes and gears, until you have a good idea of how everything works. Using the levers you get the gears into the right position, pull another lever and the bars blocking the exits start slowly moving up.
Your understanding of the mechanism suggests another configuration. You expertly move the gears again and pull the lever. You hear a mechanical sound from one of the display stands. You turn around and see the lid of the bronze chest rising up on a metal pole that apparently goes through the stand and the chest.
Inside the velvet-clad chest you find nothing but an old scroll.
[lore failure]Unfortunately, the language is unfamiliar.

dlgAnsw.text: Take the scroll and make your way downstairs.

dlgPart.npc_text:
[lore success]The scroll is written in an ancient script attributed to the Magi and those who served them.
"We beheld in the sky what appeared to us to be a mass of scarlet clouds resembling the fierce flames of a blazing fire. From that mass many blazing missiles flashed, and tremendous roars, like the noise of a thousand drums beaten at once. And from it fell many weapons winged with gold and thousands of thunderbolts, with loud explosions, and many hundreds of fiery wheels. Loud became the uproar of falling horses, slain by these missiles, and of mighty elephants struck by the explosions..."
It's a rare mantra, dedicated to ancient flying chariots that were made of blessed iron and gifted with the power of the gods. The mantra contains detailed praying instructions that might persuade the air elementals to pull such a chariot as if they were horses.

dlgAnsw.text: Take the scroll and make your way downstairs.

dlgPart.npc_text: [traps success]You're about to take a step when you notice the tell-tale signs of a pressure plate. Examining the floor reveals a network of pressure plates. The craftsmanship is superb. The plates blend in with the floor perfectly and the pattern makes it almost impossible for an intruder to avoid one. You would have missed the clues if not for your extensive experience with traps.

dlgAnsw.text: Stay where you are and wait for the hallway to clear.

dlgPart.npc_text: [perception: precognition]You're about to take a step when you get a feeling that something is wrong. You look around the room again, hunting for things that are out of the ordinary. You find them one by one and hold them in your mind, while letting the rest of the room fade away. Tiny scratches, sliding marks, oil stains, worn out spots show you pressure plates, maintenance mechanisms, trap doors, deadly holes aimed at display stands, and the bars ready to drop down and block the exit, alerting the guards to your presence.

dlgAnsw.text: Stay where you are and wait for the hallway to clear.

dlgPart.npc_text: The stands hold many strange and wondrous relics of the olden days, their purpose unknown. The central stand holds a bronze chest with decorative wooden panels.
The chest is locked tight, yet the lock is nowhere to be found. Furthermore, the chest is securely attached to the stand and can't be removed.

dlgAnsw.text: [perception]Look for a way to open the chest.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You look for the mechanism but find nothing. Wait for the hallway to clear and make your way downstairs.

[success]You methodically examine every object in the room, starting with the pressure plate that triggers the trap. When you reach the cabinet, a tap on one of the panels returns a hollow sound.
The panel slides easily to the side, exposing a maze of well-oiled gears, pipes, chains, and levers. It would take some expertise to figure out what to do with it.
[failure]You have no idea even where to start. You pull a random lever, but nothing happens. You leave the chest alone and go downstairs.
[failure]You take your time, trying not to think of the guard. You trace down all the pipes and gears, but can't find a way to open the chest. You silently leave the room and go downstairs.

[success]You take your time, trying not to think of the guard. You trace down all the pipes and gears, until you have a good idea of how the system works. You expertly move the gears again and pull the lever. You hear a mechanical sound from one of the display stands. You turn around and see the lid of the bronze chest rising up on a metal pole that apparently goes through the stand and the chest.

You drop down, landing quietly on a thick carpet. The bedroom provides temporary safety as you don't expect the guards to barge in here without a good reason.
The only objects of interests are several chests. They are unlocked and contain nothing but bed sheets, toiletries, and clothes. There is a ruby necklace on a dresser. You cut the string and pocket the gems, leaving the rest behind. There is a tractate on a side table.

"Bound I am not to teache you to have a good grace, nor anye thing els, saving only to shew you what a perfect Courtyer ought to be. Neither will I take upon me to teach you this perfeccion, sins a while a goe, I said, that the Courtier ought to have the feate of wrastlyng and vawtinge, and such other thinges, the which howe I should be able to teache them not having learned them my selfe, I am sure ye knowe it all. It sufficeth that as a good souldyer cann speake his minde to an armourer of what facion, of what temper and goodnesse he will have his harneys, and for all that cannot teache him to make it, nor to hammer or temper it: so perhaps I am able to tel you what a perfect Courtyer ought to be, but not able to teach you how ye should doe to be one. Notwithstanding to fulfill your request in what I am able..."

onLoadScripts.string: dlgAddTextBoxMessage("You gained some insights into the lost art of being a Courtier.");

dlgPart.npc_text: "Bound I am not to teache you to have a good grace, nor anye thing els, saving only to shew you what a perfect Courtyer ought to be. Neither will I take upon me to teach you this perfeccion, sins a while a goe, I said, that the Courtier ought to have the feate of wrastlyng and vawtinge, and such other thinges, the which howe I should be able to teache them not having learned them my selfe, I am sure ye knowe it all. It sufficeth that as a good souldyer cann speake his minde to an armourer of what facion, of what temper and goodnesse he will have his harneys, and for all that cannot teache him to make it, nor to hammer or temper it: so perhaps I am able to tel you what a perfect Courtyer ought to be, but not able to teach you how ye should doe to be one. Notwithstanding to fulfill your request in what I am able..."

You peek outside and see a guard patrolling the hallway. The bedroom is almost at the end of the hallway, so once the guard passes it, you'd have to move fast as you'd only have no more than ten heartbeats until he turns around. Of course, if the guard is dead, you won't have to worry about it.

dlgAnsw.text: [sneak][dexterity]Make a silent run toward the stairs leading down.

dlgPart.npc_text:
[failure]You find an elegant looking set of clothes and put them on. You practice the mannerism until you're satisfied with the persona you've conjured, then step out of the bedroom and walk down the hall.
Within moments you're surrounded by several guards. You try to explain that you're a guest of Lord Antidas but the guards drag you to the dungeon for questioning.

[success]You find an elegant looking set of clothes and put them on. You practice the mannerism until you're satisfied with the persona you've conjured, then step out of the bedroom and curse loudly. Within moments you're surrounded by several guards struggling to understand what's happening. Looking very displeased that a <man/woman> of your station has to acknowledge the existence of lowly guards and talk to them, you explain that you're a personal guest of Lord Antidas and that unless you're taken downstairs this very instant, heads will roll.
The guards glance at each other and decide that there is no harm in accompanying you downstairs. You demand more guards, claiming that a <man/woman> of your station simply can't be followed by less than twelve guards, but eventually accept a more humble escort.

[failure]You lunge at the guard but he reacts instantly. A heavy shield is smashed into your face, blurring your vision. You see a flash of metal and suddenly pain erupts in your chest, drowning your screams and attempts to draw air. You die before your body hits the ground.

[success]The guard is fast and well trained. His sword clears the scabbard and catches you as you lunge. Lucky for you, your aim was truer - your dagger finds the guard's neck and his eyes slowly roll up as he loses all interest in you.
You pull his sword out of the wound and bandage it as best as you can. The way is clear.

[success]The guard is fast and well trained, but he is no match for you. By the time he raises his shield, your dagger is buried in his neck and his eyes slowly roll up, losing any interest in you. The way is clear.

You wait for the servants to leave, then sneak inside. The only items of interests are several golden goblets and a well crafted steel dagger used for carving meat. You pocket them while considering what to do next.

[failure]You wait for the guard to pass, then dart into the hallway and run as silently as you can, counting the heartbeats. "What the..." followed by "Stop!" tells you that you've failed. You don't hear any footsteps and for a moment there you think that you have a chance. Then a javelin violently bursts through your chest, shattering your hopes. You take a few weak steps, leaving a bloody smear where you use the wall for support, then slide down and watch as the life pours from your body.

[success]You wait for the guard to pass, then dart into the hallway and run as silently as you can, counting the heartbeats. It's clear that you won't make to the stairs leading down in time. You see two rooms up ahead. The guard behind you will reach the end of the hallway and turn around at any moment now. You have no choice but to pick a room and hope for the best.

You duck into the room on your left. It's a display room where Antidas keeps his ancient curiosities. It's empty at the moment, but it's wide open and you will be fully exposed if someone were to walk in.

[sneak failure]You duck into the room on your right. It's a dining chamber. Several servants are clearing up a recent meal, their eyes fixed on their tasks. You roll under a large oak table but one of the servants sees and raises the alarm.
Before you can even grasp the situation unfolding before you, you're pinned to the ground and shackled. It's all downhill from there. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated.

[sneak success]You duck into the room on your right. It's a dining chamber. Several servants are clearing up a recent meal, their eyes fixed on their tasks. You react quickly, rolling under a large oak table before anyone can see you.

dlgAnsw.text: Wait for the servants to finish.

dlgPart.npc_text: You're standing in front of the palisade. It's tall enough to shield you from the guards. Of course, you'll probably be wide open if you manage to get to the other side.

dlgAnsw.text: [throwing]Use the rope with the grappling hook.
[dexterity][strength]Climb over the palisade without attracting the guards' attention.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You throw the rope several times, but somehow the hook fails to catch. You must be really bad at it.

dlgAnsw.text: [dexterity][strength]Climb over the palisade without attracting the guards' attention.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You try to climb but all you get is splinters for your trouble...

dlgAnsw.text: [throwing]Use the rope with the grappling hook.

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]You throw the rope and get the grappling hook exactly where you want it. You can climb up without much effort now.

dlgAnsw.text: [dexterity][strength]Climb up the rope and get over the palisade without attracting the guards' attention.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]You try to get over the palisade but fail miserably.

[success]You climb the palisade without making a sound, none of the crossbowmen showing any sign of them having noticed your ascent.
Inside the palisade is a broad, open area used for training. Your only option is to make it to the shadows of the guard house 60 feet away before you are spotted and used for target practice.

[failure]You move as quickly and quietly as you can. You're halfway through when an impact of a bolt suddenly appearing in your chest throws you on your back. Gasping for air, you lift up your head and look around.
Before you can even grasp the situation unfolding before you, you're pinned to the ground and shackled. It's all downhill from there. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated.
[success]You move like a ghost, giving the guards neither movement, nor sounds to react to. Before long, you stand within the temporary safety of the guard house's shadow, considering your options.

It looks like there are two ways to get inside the main building: over the roof or through the guard house, which is connected to the main building.
You can probably make it around the left corner and sneak into the guardhouse. Alternatively, you can climb to the second storey of the guard house and look for another way in. If running into people doesn't fit your plans you can sneak behind the buildings and find a good spot to get to the roof of the main building.
Also there is an old stone tower set in the town wall with a parapet connecting the second storey to the guard house.

dlgAnsw.text: [dexterity][strength]Climb to the second storey of the guard house.
Quietly make your way to the back of the palace and go to the east side of the compound.

dlgPart.npc_text:
[failure]You blend with the wall and start moving, carefully watching the guards. You cut the corner, being now no more than ten feet away from the guards. A misstep causes one of the guards to glance back, making sure that everything is in order, and within seconds all hell breaks loose.
Before you can even grasp the situation unfolding before you, you're pinned to the ground and shackled. It's all downhill from there. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated.

[success]You blend with the wall and start moving, carefully watching the guards. You cut the corner, being now no more than ten feet away from the guards, and keep moving slowly, barely breathing and checking your every step. Soon you reach the door, push it open and step inside.
[failure]You try to climb it, but the crumbling mortar makes it almost impossible for you to gain a hold.
[success]The building is old and could use some repair and maintenance. Missing bricks and crumbling mortar make climbing it barely more challenging than using a ladder.

You approach the tower entrance. Inside, the ground floor serves as a makeshift storage area for weapons and water barrels. A ladder ascends to the next level, watched by a single guard sitting on a barrel. At the moment, his attention is focused on a fairly large topaz he's polishing with motherly love and affection.

dlgAnsw.text: [critical strike]Take the guard out before he can call for help.

dlgPart.npc_text:
[failure]Your attack catches the guard by surprise as he clearly didn't expect to be attacked within the compound. He falls backwards, thrashing around and choking on his own blood. He kicks the barrel he was sitting on, sending it into one of the weapon racks. As if all that noise wasn't enough, the guard manages to clear his throat of blood and produce a gut-wrenching scream that could wake the dead.
Before you can even grasp the situation unfolding before you, you're pinned to the ground and shackled. It's all downhill from there. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated.

[success]Your attack catches the guard by surprise as he clearly didn't expect to be attacked within the compound. He falls backwards and lies motionless in a quickly expanding puddle of blood. You pick up the topaz and slowly go up the ladder.

In this small room on the outer wall, two guards are monitoring the approach to town through a pair of arrow loops. A centurion studies something in a small office between the apertures.
A makeshift bridge will take you to the guard house.

dlgAnsw.text: [critical strike][sneak]Take out the guards from behind, one by one, then deal with the centurion.

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]Crouching, you move across the room like a shadow. You're about to reach out and cut his throat, when the guard whirls around, slashing you with his gladius. For a while, you attempt to keep your intestines from falling out, but it's not a game that you can win. Your death is quick but painful.

[success]Crouching, you move across the room like a shadow. When you get close enough, you lunge, clapping your hand over the guard's mouth as you ram your dagger between the man's ribs, then gently lower the body to the floor.
You take out the other guard without much difficulty. When you turn around you see the centurion standing outside of his office.
"Don't worry," he says after a pause. "I won't call for help. It's a matter of honour." Then he pulls out his sword.
FIGHT - Flavius

The centurion finally goes down. He looks surprised – it's certainly not the outcome he expected.
You carefully unfasten his armor and helmet, and wipe off the blood. You pack the rest neatly into your backpack - an old bag with faded lettering you bought from a man who claimed to be an arcanist a long time ago.

dlgAnsw.text: Put them on and go to the main building.

dlgPart.npc_text: "Who are you and what are you doing here?" Flavius hand finds the sword's pommel and rests there comfortably. For now.

dlgAnsw.text: "I was told to report to you. I want to work for House Daratan."

dlgPart.npc_text: "What are you doing here, <charname>?" asks Flavius.

dlgAnsw.text: "I was told to report to you. I want to work for House Daratan."

dlgPart.npc_text: "What skills do you have?"
"Someone will be crucified for it."
"Indeed. However, I feel that I must give my man a chance to redeem himself. I hope you will have no objections."

"Quite so. Since he's to die because of you, it will only be fitting if he'll die by your hand. Might as well finish the job. And, of course, if my man manages to do what he should have done in the first place – gut you like a fish as a lesson to everyone who tries to fast talk their way inside the compound - well then, I'd consider the matter settled and proper lessons learned.
"Should you prevail, I will welcome you with open arms and personally vouch for you. Unless, of course, you've changed your mind about joining this Noble House."

dlgAnsw.text: "I'm ready. Let's get it over with."

[persuasion]"I'm not a fighting <man/woman>, so you might as well order your men to cut me down and give him," nod at the guard who let you in, "a pat on the back for a job well done. If you think he deserves it."
"It's not for me. I made a mistake."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"Good idea. Kill <him/her>." The guards smile and draw their weapons.
[success]"If you're not a fighter, what good are you to me?" Flavius asks reasonably.

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion][charisma]"Like I said, I've made it this far. If fighting men could handle everything, we wouldn't be having this conversation right now, would we? To put it simply, there are certain situations where brute force isn't the best approach. A <man/woman> like me might come in handy."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"I'm not convinced. Yet. Let's put these skills, you think so highly of, to the test. I'll let you go now. If you can make it to Lord Antidas without getting killed by one of my men, then we'd certainly be interested in a <man/woman> of your talents. Otherwise..."

[success]"You do have a way with words and you did make it this far. The least we can do is give you a chance and see how it goes. After all, we can always kill you." Flavius laughs and slaps your shoulder. "Let's go. Lord Antidas makes it his business to know every man who serves him."
FIGHT - guard
"Congratulations. You will understand one day why it was necessary. Report to Lord Antidas. He makes it his business to know everyone who serves him."
"I'm disappointed, but I respect your decision. Kill <him/her>." The guards smile and draw their weapons.
FIGHT - Flavius and guards

You look at the dead bodies sprawled around you and the blood slowly spreading on the floor. An unfortunate turn of events, but better them than you.
You carefully step around the bodies, until you reach Flavius. Poor bastard's lying there with a surprised look on his face. It's definitely not what he had in mind. You carefully unfasten his centurion armor and helmet, and wipe off the blood. You pack the rest neatly into your backpack - an old bag with faded lettering you bought from a man who claimed to be an arcanist a long time ago.

dlgAnsw.text: Put them on and go to the main building.

dlgPart.npc_text:
君はアンティダスの広間に立ち、富と権力の印に囲まれていた。どちらを向いてもエキゾチックなタペストリーや絵画、珍しい花瓶や煌めく彫像を見ることができる。絢爛とした柱が広間に建ち並び、アンティダス卿の座する玉座へと至る。彼は援助と好意を求める請願者のグループに謁見を許していた。兵士達は見張りをしており、トラブルの兆しが見えた瞬間にいつでもアンティダスを守り広間を虐殺の場にする用意があった。
You wait for your turn and then approach the throne.
"So, you're the new recruit that Flavius brought in. Swear your fealty to me and you'll be welcomed into my House."

dlgAnsw.text: "I swear my fealty to you, my Lord."

[etiquette success]"I swear to serve you, your cause, and House Daratan faithfully, never cause you harm and will observe my homage to you completely against all persons in good faith and without deceit."

dlgPart.npc_text: Antidas nods. "Serve me faithfully and you'll be aptly rewarded."

Clearly pleased with your oath, Antidas nods. "<Men/Women> like you are hard to find these days. I have faith in you. Serve me faithfully and you'll be aptly rewarded." He removes one of his rings and gives it to you.
END - start Antidas main quest dialogue
END - talk to Dellar about quests
DEAD

君はアンティダスの広間に立ち、富と権力の印に囲まれていた。どちらを向いてもエキゾチックなタペストリーや絵画、珍しい花瓶や煌めく彫像を見ることができる。絢爛とした柱が広間に建ち並び、アンティダス卿の座する玉座へと至る。彼は援助と好意を求める請願者のグループに謁見を許していた。兵士達は見張りをしており、トラブルの兆しが見えた瞬間にいつでもアンティダスを守り広間を虐殺の場にする用意があった。
You move through the crowd trying to blend in and attract as little attention as possible, but your efforts are futile. When you're about to approach Lord Antidas, Dellar blocks your way and almost immediately a score of heavily armoured guards surrounds you.
"When you made it this far, you made it too far. Take <him/her> away." Before the guards can react, you hear "Let <him/her> speak." The voice of a man accustomed to command. The armored wall parts and you're pushed forward until you are standing in front of Lord Antidas.

"You went to great lengths to seek my audience. I don't have a habit of talking to those who come into my home uninvited, but I can't help but admire your skills. I can certainly use a <man/woman> of your abilities. Is that why you're here... to sell me your services?"
"I accept. Swear your fealty to me and we shall consider the matters settled."

dlgAnsw.text: "I swear my fealty to you, my Lord."

[etiquette success]"I swear to serve you, your cause, and House Daratan faithfully, never cause you harm and will observe my homage to you completely against all persons in good faith and without deceit."

dlgPart.npc_text: "You kill my men and have the nerve to approach me? Dellar thinks I shouldn't kill you. Not just yet, at least. So, go ahead, tell me why I should overlook the insult and spare your worthless life."
"We don't need the likes of you here."

dlgAnsw.text: [body count]"Killing folks has always been easy for me. It's not a talent that many people admire, but every now and then comes a time when you want someone dead. A <man/woman> of my skills might come in handy."

dlgPart.npc_text:
[failure]"You presume too much. Dellar, take <him/her> away."
Before you can even grasp the situation unfolding before you, you're pinned to the ground and shackled. It's all downhill from there. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated. The answers you give fail to satisfy the guards and soon the torturers take their turn. First they take your fingers, then your eyes. At some point, you stop paying attention to pain and your own screams, and slowly drift away.
[success]"Good at killing, you say? I think that a demonstration of your abilities is in order. Dellar will tell you what needs to be done."
"It looks familiar, but doesn't answer my question. Why I should overlook the insult and spare your worthless life?"

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion]"I did kill a few men but they were of no use to you, my Lord. Their incompetence was putting your life in danger. Had they been properly selected and trained, I would be dead or in chains, and they would still be alive, would they not?"

[etiquette success]"My Lord, I beg forgiveness for my actions, but I was given little choice. I was entrusted with a tribute for you, which I was honour-bound to deliver. When the guards refused me entry, they refused you, my Lord. Is it not a sacred duty of every man to defend the honour of his lord?"

[body count]"Killing folks has always been easy for me. It's not a talent that many people admire, but every now and then comes a time when you want someone dead. A <man/woman> of my skills might come in handy."

dlgPart.npc_text:
[failure]"Yes, they would be alive and you would be dead or in chains. I can do nothing about the former, but I can certainly arrange the latter. Dellar, take <him/her> away."
Before you can even grasp the situation unfolding before you, you're pinned to the ground and shackled. It's all downhill from there. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated. The answers you give fail to satisfy the guards and soon the torturers take their turn. First they take your fingers, then your eyes. At some point, you stop paying attention to pain and your own screams, and slowly drift away.

[success]"I can't believe it. Instead of begging for forgiveness, you're actually trying to convince me that you did me a favour! Dellar, put <his/her> skills to the test. If <he/she> survives it, bring <him/her> back to me."

"Honor is a rare trait these days. It's what separates us from savages and keeps the spirit of the Empire alive.
"You did well then. I can always find more guards, but a <man/woman> of your resourcefulness and devotion will be hard to find. Waste not, as my father used to say. He was a great man." For a moment Antidas is lost in thought.
"Very well. Consider your crimes absolved. Dellar, see to it that this <man/woman> is taken care of. Now, what was that about the tribute?"

"None shall be given. Dellar, take <him/her> away."
Before you can even grasp the situation unfolding before you, you're pinned to the ground and shackled. It's all downhill from there. You're taken to the dungeon and interrogated. The answers you give fail to satisfy the guards and soon the torturers take their turn. First they take your fingers, then your eyes. At some point, you stop paying attention to pain and your own screams, and slowly drift away.

"I've already given <him/her> a task," says Dellar. "I'm a bit surprised to find <charname> skulking around the compound instead of doing what <he/she> was told. Not the sharpest knife, is <he/she>?"
"Perhaps not," replies Antidas. "Still, if <charname> is as good as <he/she> says <he/she> is, we can definitely put <his/her> abilities to good use. Bring <him/her> back to me if <he/she> passes the test."

Two torturers examine you professionally, discussing how they're going to proceed as if you aren't even there. To them, you're tonight's entertainment. Their discussion is interrupted by the arrival of a young praetor.
"Ah, the assassin... Who sent you?"

dlgAnsw.text: "Nobody. I had to show this map to Lord Antidas, but the guards wouldn't let me in."

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Well, you sure showed them. Let us return the courtesy then," says the praetor and nods to the torturers.
First they take your fingers, then your eyes. At some point, you stop paying attention to pain and your own screams, and slowly drift away.

Two torturers examine you professionally, discussing how they're going to proceed as if you aren't even there. To them, you're tonight's entertainment. Their discussion is interrupted by the arrival of a young praetor.
"Let's make it quick, shall we?" he says, wincing at the smell. "Who sent you?"

dlgAnsw.text: "Nobody. I had to show this map to Lord Antidas, but the guards wouldn't let me in."

dlgPart.npc_text: "So, you decided to take the matters into your own hand? To risk your own life over some map? Now, that's what I call dedication," says the praetor and nods to the torturers.
"I want to believe you. I really do, but we need to be sure." He pats your cheek and walks away, letting the torturers take their turn.

"Wake up, it's not an inn," the praetor's voice returns you to reality and pain. "It does look that your only crime is not being the brightest torch, but it's probably not your fault anyway.
"You're free to go. By that I mean, throw <him/her> out."

Two men grab you by the arms and drag you through the compound. At some point you pass out from pain and when you open your eyes again, you find yourself lying on the ground and bleeding. Better go and see a doctor.
END - leave - TA closed
